title: Is a blue suit and a long red tie an American swastika? - Democratic Underground Forums
text: Welcome to DU! The truly grassroots left-of-center political community where regular people, not algorithms, drive the discussions and set the standards. Join the community: [Create a free account](/?com=login&create=1)Support DU (and get rid of ads!): [Become a Star Member](/star) [Latest Breaking News](/?com=forum&id=1014) [General Discussion](/?com=forum&id=1002) [The DU Lounge](/?com=forum&id=1018) [All Forums](/?com=forums) [Issue Forums](/?com=forum&id=1311) [Culture Forums](/?com=forum&id=1312) [Alliance Forums](/?com=forum&id=1313) [Region Forums](/?com=forum&id=1314) [Support Forums](/?com=forum&id=1315) [Help & Search](/?com=search) Related: [General Discussion](/?com=forum&id=1002) [Editorials & Other Articles](/?com=forum&id=1016), [Issue Forums](/?com=forum&id=1311), [Alliance Forums](/?com=forum&id=1313), [Region Forums](/?com=forum&id=1314) (15,109 posts) Thu Jun 6, 2024, 05:14 PM 21 min ago [Cyrano](/?com=profile&uid=142992) No, I'm not being sarcastic. A bunch of Republican congressmen showed up at at Trump's New York trial wearing blue suits and red ties. Given that Trump's authoritarian desires are so obvious, it seems that these ring-kissers will back their "Dear Leader" no matter what. The sad part is that, those Republican house members and senators don't have the slightest idea that they may as well be wearing the equivalent of swastika armbands. So they're either totally ignorant of modern history, or they are true Nazi pricks. I can't see a third alternative.
